intro: Tacsonia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly tacsonia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a soft, fuzzy appearance. It produces small, clustered white flowers that bloom in spring. Tacsonia tomentosa is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique texture and visual appeal.
